snippet: If the call for help comes, it might stop well short of invoking the full force of the bond-buying program that the European Central Bank announced with Spain in mind back in September.
abstract: Spanish government edges closer to deciding whether to ask for European financial assistance, following months of delay; if call for help comes, it may stop well short of seeking an outright loan from Europe's bailout fund and instead opt for a precautionary line of credit, to be used only in emergencies.
lead_paragraph: If the call for help comes, it might stop well short of invoking the full force of the bond-buying program that the European Central Bank announced with Spain in mind back in September.
